result.execSummary:
The defendant Jorge D Castillo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
CONCURRENT; as to both counts

Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 01/15/2016 @ 1:30pm, Br-36

miscConds.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge . To be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued. Bail on deposit, if any, to apply.
- No contact with firearms. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
DEFENSE MOTION FOR EXPUNGEMENT IS GRANTED PROVIDED THE DEFENDANT HAS PAID ALL OF HIS COSTS AND SURCHARGES AND COMPLIED WITH THE CONDITIONS OF HIS PROBATION.

CONDITIONS:
- Complete Batterer's intervention program.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No Contact with victim unless approved by the court. Defendant may have No Violent Contact with the victim once he has started batterers treatment.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Pay supervision fees.

records.addlTxt:
The probation agent presented an order for the court's signature and was present in court.  The defendant's attorney, Scott Connors, spoke to the defendant and he agreed to stipulate to the order.  The court ordered that the defendant is to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, straight time, with -0- credit.  Order signed and filed.
File forwarded to the Clerk of Court's Office for processing.
cab

Department of Correction is requesting condition time be imposed by the court. Court orders case adjourned to 4/5/2016 at 8:30 for hearing. District Attorney's Office, Public Defender's Office and Agent have been notified. Defendant to be produced for hearing. Case calendared in Br. 36 for Hearing.   Deputy Court Clerk: AMI

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Kremers
for review. os

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[ x ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment

Defendant Jorge D Castillo in court.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Defendant Jorge D Castillo in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Set for trial but defendant wants to change his plea.
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
.
Sentencing continued.  Statement by the parties.  Additional statement by:  Anjelica M.
As to counts 1 and 2:
  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction as to count 1 and 4 months in the House of Correction as to count 2, consecutive,  with credit for 1 day served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for up to 16 months, concurrent,  with the following conditions:
- Serve 30 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.  Defendant may have no violent contact with the victim once he has started batterer's treatment.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.

Defense motion for expungement is granted provided the defendant has paid ALL of his costs and surcharges and complied with the conditions of his probation.  
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jorge D Castillo not in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Neither defense counsel nor the defendant appeared today.  
State's Witness List received and filed.
The clerk contacted defense counsel and did not have this date written down.  He wants to continue the case for trial.
Court told Attorney Thomey to appear with his client on the jury trial date of 10/28/2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jorge D Castillo in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case was scheduled for a plea and sentencing date today.  The defendant has changed his mind and now wants a trial.
The state is to give the defense the correct 911 tape within 2 weeks.
Offers are revoked at this point.
Defense motion for a modification of bail is denied by the court.  Bail remains $300.00.
Case adjourned for a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 36.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jorge D Castillo in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. All conditions of bail remain in effect.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jorge D Castillo in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called at 1:30 PM. Defendant admonished to appear in court on time as scheduled. Case set for a Status Conference. Defense counsel requests case be adjourned for an additional status conference. Case adjourned to branch 23  Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jorge D Castillo in court. Attorney Richard E. Thomey, NOT in court unable to appear.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel unable to appear due to scheduling conflict. Case is adjourned for a Status Conference date in branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard E. Thomey in court, defendant Jorge D Castillo not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant previously in court, taken in to custody on unrelated warrant. Defense counsel requests case be set for a Status Conference. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

$200.00 bail to be returned. Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-20-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jorge D Castillo in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.23  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/4/15 @ 1:30 pm
